key_facts: A World Weather Attribution analysis examined deadly weather events.
Human-induced climate change intensified the ten deadliest weather events.
The deadliest weather events occurred over the past 20 years.
These events include droughts, heatwaves, and cyclones.
Over 570,000 people died in these events.
The events affected Europe, Africa, and Asia.
Climate change worsened the 2011 Somalia drought.
Climate change worsened multiple European heatwaves.
Climate change worsened deadly tropical cyclones.
Researchers used simulations to compare current and pre-industrial scenarios.
Rising global temperatures are linked to extreme weather.
Fatalities from extreme weather are likely underreported in poorer nations.
Experts stress the need for improved climate resilience.
Extreme weather is expected to worsen with more global warming.
